original.name: Alien Outpost
original.body: When you receive this card, draw one card from the flare deck. Place the matching alien sheet next to this card, then remove that flare from the game. If the alien has Game Setup text, is not allowed in this game, or has an alternate victory condition, discard it and draw again. While you have a colony on this planet, you have this alien power in addition to any other alien(s) you control.

revised.name: Alien Outpost
revised.body: When you receive this card, draw one card from the unused flare deck. Place the matching alien sheet next to this card, then remove that flare from the game. If the alien has Game Setup text, is not allowed in this game, or has an alternate victory condition, discard it and draw again. While you have a colony on this planet, you have this alien power in addition to any other alien(s) you control.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for wording consistency

original.name: Big Space Laser
original.body: As a main player, after you reveal an attack card, you may add 10 to your total if there are no allies on your side.

original.name: Colony Cloak
original.body: As the defense, after the hyperspace gate is aimed at one of your colonies or planets in this system, you may send one of your ships from this space station's planet to the warp. Then, the offense must (if possible) target a different colony or planet in this system where he or she can have a legal encounter.

original.name: Cosmic Energy Generator
original.body: After your side wins an encounter, place two tokens on this card. After your side loses an encounter, discard one token from this card. As long as there are five or more tokens on this card, it counts as a foreign colony toward victory.

original.name: Observation Platform
original.body: After alliances are formed during an encounter in which you are not involved, you may either retrieve one ship from the warp or draw one card from the deck.

revised.name: Observation Platform
revised.body: After alliances are formed, if you are not a main player or ally, you may recieve one reward.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw

Edited to be consistent with Odyssey's observation platform, which is clearer in its wording and to give it a small buff to make it not a subset of Odyssey's observation platform. The latter is a very opinionated change, feel free to ignore it.

original.name: Shield Generator
original.body: As an ally in a losing encounter, instead of sending your ships to the warp, you may place any or all of those ships on this planet instead.

original.name: Shock Trooper Shuttle Pods
original.body: During each other player's regroup phase, you may retrieve one of your ships from the warp. If you have no ships in the warp, you may instead choose one player to send one of his or her ships to the warp.

original.name: Tactical Array
original.body: As the defense, during the launch phase, you may draw two cards from the deck.

original.name: Temporal Matrix
original.body: If you lose the first encounter of your turn, you may still have a second encounter as long as you have an encounter card in your hand. If you win the first encounter of your turn and choose to have a second encounter, you may place the destiny card from the first encounter on top of the destiny deck.

original.name: Transdimensional Rift Relay
original.body: As a main player, after encounter cards are revealed, if you have at least one ship in the encounter, you may send up to four of your ships from this planet and add them to your ships already in the encounter. You may use this ability for encounters in any system.

original.name: Artifact Detection Grid
original.body: After another player plays an artfiact card, you may gain one reward.

original.name: Fluxx Capacitor
original.body:
After alliances are formed, if you were invited to both sides, place a cosmic token on this card.

After cards are selected but before they are revealed, if you are an ally, you may spend a token from this card to switch to the other side.

original.name: Massive Battery
original.body: When you play a reinforcement card, increase its value by the number of your ships on this planet.

original.name: Observation Platform
original.body: After alliances are formed, if you are not a main player or ally, you may either free two of your ships from the warp or draw one card from the deck.

timing.player: Not Main Player or Ally Only

original.name: Orbital Billboards
original.body: During your regroup phase, you may show your entire hand to all players. If you do this, double the value of an attack card you reveal in this encounter. If you double an attack card in this way, send one of your ships from this planet to the warp.

original.name: Oscillation Overthruster
original.body: After determining the winner of the encounter, add both encounter totals together. If the sum is at least 42, you may send all of your ships from this planet to the targeted planet.

original.name: Stun Apparatus
original.body: As a main player, after encounter cards are revealed, the value of your opponent's attack card is reduced by the number of ships on this planet (before any other effects alter that card's value) to a minimum of 00.

original.name: Targeting Depot
original.body: As an ally, before encounter cards are selected, you may show an attack card from your hand to all players. The value of each main player's revealed attack card becomes the difference between its printed value and the card you showed; e.g. if you showed a 12, a revealed 12 would be worth 08 and a revealed 03 would be worth 09.

original.name: Rift Enacter
original.body: After a player takes an attack 01-06 from your hand, you may force that player to lose a number of their ships equal to the value of the card and discard that card. During the regroup phase, you may discard an attack 01-06 to free a number of the offense's ships from the warp equal to the value of the card.

original.name: Zap Zapper
original.body: When a card with "Zap" in its name is played, you may send one ship from this planet to the warp to cancel and discard that card.

original.name: Big Sky Laser
original.body: As a main player, after encounter cards are revealed, you may add 3 to your total for each player with a colony on this planet.

original.name: Exhortation
original.body:
Each player who does not have a colony on this planet has the following effects:

When they fail to make a deal, they lose three additional ships.

When they have compensation collected from them, increase that compensation by two cards.

original.name: Golden City
original.body: After you make a deal, gain two rewards.

original.name: Hand Additor
original.body: When you draw a new hand (including your starting hand), draw two additional cards.

original.name: Icy Optimization
original.body: During your regroup phase, instead of retrieving a ship from the warp, you may discard a card from your hand.

original.name: Recycler
original.body: As an ally, after the outcome of the encounter is determined, you may shuffle the discard pile and draw one card from it at random.

original.name: Warp Harvester
original.body: As an ally, when you play a reinforcement card, increase its value by the number of ships you have in the warp.

original.name: Zaptimizer
original.body:
You may treat any artifact you play as a Card Zap:

Play this card at any time to negate a flare or artifact card just as a player attempts to use it. The flare or artifact must then be discarded.

revised.name: Zaptimizer
revised.body:
You may treat any artifact you play as a Card Zap:

Play at any time to negate a flare or artifact card just as a player attempts to use it. The flare or artifact must then be discarded.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw

Edited to be consistent with the Cosmodex's revised Card Zap

original.name: Burst Targeter
original.body: As the defense or a defensive ally, before encounter cards are selected, you may force two ships of your choice on the other side to return to their colonies.

revised.name: Burst Targeter
revised.body: As the defense or a defensive ally, before encounter cards are selected, you may force two ships of your choice on the other side to return to their colonies.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw

Edited for wording consistency

original.name: Freewheeling Intensifier
original.body: You can play any number of flares per encounter. (Each flare can only be played once per encounter.) At the end of the encounter, if you played only one flare, you may draw one flare from the unused flare deck, and then discard one flare.

original.name: High-Activity Staging Zone
original.body: As a main player, when a player becomes your opponent's ally, they must specifiy the number of ships they wish to send. Then, you choose which colonies those ships come from.

original.name: Hyperspace Redirect
original.body: As the defense, before allies are invited, you may declare the effects of winning for allies is reversed (i.e. offensive allies gain rewards, defensive allies land on the targeted planet).

original.name: Obligatron
original.body: As an ally, after you send ships into the encounter, declare a number. For each play that becomes an ally after you, if that player sends more ships than the number you chose, you may take a card from their hand at random.

original.name: Population Monitor
original.body: As a main player, after cards are revealed, you may add 2 to your total for each of your home colonies.

original.name: Quark Refinery
original.body: As a main player, if you reveal an odd-valued attack card, you may increase its value by 5. If your opponent reveals an odd-valued attack card, you may reduce its value by 5.

original.name: Option Cycler
original.body: As a main player, after you reveal an attack card with a value of at least 11, you may treat it as a negotiate. If the card's value was at least 20, collect triple the compensation, if applicable.
